page.title: 02Local History-2 GUILDRY INC.
page.content: The Guildry Incorporation of Perth - a Mediaeval Trades' Society - once owned the whole of our area and still administer most of the land and farms around here. They built this village about 1820. Every year on the first Wednesday in June, the members of the Guildry led by the Dean of Guild visit and inspect their properties. They always pay a courtesy visit to the School where they are entertained. After this and refreshments there is the "Scramble". This is when the Dean throws bags of new money (loose, of course!) to each class group in turn. It is great fun for us children, but our Headteacher, Miss Reid does not like it as she says it is degrading. But it is a part of our history and she is going to let it continue as long as we behave and not grab other people's money from them.
